11/ Please discuss among the community! Your input, feedback, and voting decisions are what drive Terra forward.   An on-chain proposal for the above will follow within the next 48 hours.

10/ A shorter on-chain voting period can also encourage more deliberate engagement from stakeholders.   A reduced window to discuss/vote on proposals can lead to more active social signaling and discourse on the subject matter without topics being buried under new developments.

9/ This proposal conveys that the benefits of decisive activation of community votes in a hyper-paced industry where shipping speed can have a meaningful impact on outcomes outweigh the potential downside of removing 7 days from the voting window.

8/ In particular, more prominent proposals like activating IBC and initiating Col-5 passed with nearly unanimous approval and with quorums reached within days.   Reducing the voting period will increase the speed with which successful proposals are implemented.

7/ However, multiple proposals over the past year have either met, exceeded, or failed to meet ‚ÄúYes‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo‚Äù quorum requirements within a much shorter period.   By the time the 14-day voting period ends, the results of most proposals are firmly in hand for up to a week or more.

6/ The voting period allows sufficient time for stakeholders to consider/discuss how to cast their votes across diverse time zones/schedules.   Currently, the live voting period is 14 days after the LUNA minimum deposit is made.

5/ Shortening the on-chain voting period:   Goal -- minimize the delay period between successful votes passing the quorum threshold and when they are activated by shortening the active voting period from 14 days to 7 days.

4/ Reducing the minimum voting deposit to 50 LUNA (~2,200 UST) alleviates this issue while still maintaining adequate protection against spamming the voting process -- the primary reason for the minimum deposit.

3/ LUNA‚Äôs significant price increase since the time the parameters were set makes the deposit equivalent to ~23K $UST at current prices, resulting in potentially value-additive and thoroughly discussed props on Agora often being left unactionable due to fear of slashing risk.

2/ Reducing the LUNA deposit minimum:   Goal -- encourage more active gov participation by making the minimum deposit less onerous to users who may be precluded from initiating on-chain governance votes due to the risk of losing the current 512 LUNA deposit if the vote fails.

8/ Notably, burning the locked 700 million SDT at once would require software changes only possible with a major network upgrade, meaning that we could technically burn the remaining SDT as part of an upcoming software upgrade to the Terra protocol.
7/ The illiquid portions of the remaining 700 million SDT to be vested over the next 7 years will be burned as they unlock -- sent to the same burn address.
6/ The proposal, if executed, will permanently burn the remainder of the SDT Stability Reserve by sending the current 11,003,512 SDT in the TFL wallet to a burn address.
5/ With LUNA one of the largest and most liquid assets in crypto, Terra needs the SDT reserve no longer - hence, TFL moves that the balance of the entire SDT reserve be burnt.

4/ Therefore, the SDT reserve provided a valuable means for $KRT and $UST to be created in the early days of the network without egregious slippage, allowing early use cases like Chai and swap pools across Terra and Ethereum to be born.

3/ As you may recall, minting Terra stablecoins uses a ‚Äúvirtual amm‚Äù pool against LUNA, where the size of the pool (and consequently the exchange costs) are proportional to the off-chain liquidity of LUNA.    https://t.co/78SPpeZBmd

2/ The SDT Stability Reserve was initially created in the genesis block of Columbus-1 mainnet to bootstrap the creation of Terra stablecoins while neither Terra nor $LUNA assets had sufficient liquidity.

12/ Operational, trust-minimized cross-chain bridges with significant liquidity pulsing through them seemed like a pipe dream only several years ago, but the vision is finally manifesting.   Welcome to Wormhole, the newest cross-chain portal from Terra to Solana, Ethereum, & BSC
11/ The post below provides a comprehensive overview of using the Wormhole UI, including migrating Shuttle assets to USTw and LUNAw and transferring them across the bridge.    https://t.co/2gWsIq2KxW

10/ Please pay attention to notices and disclaimers on exchanges and DeFi-native pools to ensure that you are interacting with the right token (i.e., Wormhole or Shuttle) in the short term until Shuttle is eventually deprecated.
9/ Exchanges and projects on Ethereum, Solana and BSC have been notified of the gradual phase-out of Shuttle liquidity, and  and  are also currently working on migrations to Wormhole.

8/ Once the Terra Bridge integration is complete, all Shuttle assets (e.g., ANC, MIR, etc) will be ready to migrate to Wormhole via the Terra Bridge interface. You can find a list of all the Shuttle assets below.   https://t.co/z1jmQq4uJ0

7/ The tickers for Wormhole UST and LUNA on Ethereum, BSC, and Solana are USTw and LUNAw. If you hold Shuttle UST or LUNA on Ethereum or BSC, you need to migrate your tokens to USTw and LUNAw before transferring them across Wormhole.   Details are provided in the blog post.

6/ The plan is to gradually phase out Shuttle token liquidity, hook Wormhole into Terra Bridge, and drive liquidity to Wormhole. In the current Wormhole support for Terra, both UST and LUNA will be available to transfer between chains.

5/ However, Wormhole will become the preferred cross-chain bridge for Terra to Ethereum, BSC, and Solana as a decentralized improvement over Shuttle.   Due to the nature of decentralized blockchains, both Shuttle assets and Wormhole assets will co-exist in the short term.

4/ With Wormhole now supporting Terra, it‚Äôs also important to denote the difference between Shuttle assets and Wormhole assets, which are two different tokens.   Shuttle is the current centralized bridge supporting the Terra Bridge interface.

3/ A cross-chain demand apparatus for UST supplemented by the closed-loop cycle of stablecoin demand native to apps on Terra has been years in the making.   It‚Äôs finally beginning to manifest as a reality for the Terra economy.

2/ Wormhole is a profound technology at the forefront of cross-chain interoperability.   For Terra, it opens another avenue for exporting UST across chains and for various use cases, accruing seigniorage to LUNA holders contingent on increasing demand for UST.

8/ Plans for Ozone and the community pool will be clarified soon as Ozone finalizes its audit and prepares for launch. Please stay tuned for further updates.

7/ Ozone is currently undergoing an audit and is expected to launch in mid-late October.   Obviously, the LUNA price and amount in the community pool have changed significantly since the original proposal.
6/ $1 billion from the community pool will be burned via the on-chain swap (LUNA ‚Üí UST) to bootstrap Ozone. Ozone is an algorithmic, claims-based insurance protocol approaching launch on Terra.

5/ Community Pool & Ozone:   Since 100% of LUNA is burned in Columbus-5, no more seigniorage will be diverted to the community pool. Currently, the community pool contains roughly 98.675 million LUNA, equating to approximately $3.5 billion.

4/ By closely tethering LUNA demand to UST demand, LUNA value capture becomes a function of UST‚Äôs adoption in a thriving cross-chain, Internet-native environment. As a result, more demand for UST shifts LUNA‚Äôs demand curve outward, while LUNA‚Äôs supply curve contracts.
3/ Economic Changes:   Columbus-5 simplifies the Treasury Module logic of the Terra protocol so that 100% of the $LUNA seigniorage generated by the expansion of the $UST supply is burned.
2/ Col-5 unlocks numerous dimensions for the Terra ecosystem to better capture value, port assets across IBC-enabled chains, and set the foundation for a vibrant TeFi economy.

14/ With swelling billions of TVL, tens of thousands of new users, and an amazing and devoted community, prudence is the optimal path forward for such a significant launch.   Thanks for your patience and understanding.   More updates to follow soon. Please stay tuned.

13/ Columbus-5 will unlock multiple new dimensions for value capture, interoperability, and scalability improvements on Terra.   Assuring the smoothest launch possible is in the best interest of the #LUNAtic community and the future of Terra.
12/ On 09/23, the exact sequence of events for the Columbus-5 mainnet launch will be shared publicly, providing details about what to expect and how the launch will be executed.

11/ The official migration guides for Mirror and Anchor will be released on September 13th, meaning web apps, contracts, and bots will be functional and operational on Bombay for users by this time.   TerraSwap has already been migrated.

10/ However, it‚Äôs in the best, most prudent interest of Terra to offer more rigorous documentation addressing questions received from ecosystem partners and third-party teams after announcing the Col-5 Bombay testnet.   The documentation updates will occur on September 10th.

9/ Third:   Provide more thorough and expansive documentation for the community and third-party developers on the specifics of the Col-5 upgrade and how to use it properly.   Currently, you can find the documentation wiki for Col-5 below:    https://t.co/KrRnwUoAJV

8/ The original timeline produced a hurried window for some projects to properly prep for Col-5.   Giving projects more time to acquaint themselves with the Col-5 testing environment and migration plans for major apps ensures a smoother runway for projects launching post-Col-5.
7/ Terra is not the same as it was in January of this year. TVL has swelled to $7.3 billion, and tens of thousands of new stakeholders, community members, and builders have entered the ecosystem.

6/ Second:   Provide more breathing room for third-party projects building on Terra with dependencies on existing apps like Mirror, Anchor, TerraSwap, and Shuttle migrating to Col-5.   This includes easing the burden of familiarizing themselves with the new Mantle design.

5/ Since Mantle plays a critical role in mediating application network traffic on Terra, ensuring the compatibility of the new version between Col-4 and Col-5 is paramount, requiring additional testing to verify the new design changes.
